author: DamiLee
description: Long-term life in low gravity can break down the human body—muscles shrink, bones weaken, even vision fades. Kajima Corporation’s “Lunar Glass” concept imagines spinning habitats that recreate Earth-like gravity, designed for future generations born off-world. Space isn’t just for astronauts anymore—it’s for families, cities, and the idea of permanence. What do you think about life beyond Earth?
title: What would it feel like to grow up where Earth’s gravity doesn’t exist?
